channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024070279
item.description:
Report X-2024070279

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No spill. Hazmat, undeclared (no DOT labels/markings on outer packaging, no Overpack label). Torn fiberboard box. One 76lb SAFT No. 414975 Mod. 409CH2 NiCad Battery Assy. Note: inner packaging (also a fiberboard box) has UNPOP, diamond label, UN number, and Proper Shipping Name. No OP-950A, OP-900, or HAZ SVC code.

item.title: Report X-2024070222
item.description:
Report X-2024070222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Hazmat, undeclared (no DOT labels/markings) and overweight (100lb. See 49CFR 173.27(f)(2)(iii) for LQ weight limit and FXG hazmat shipping guide page 8 for fully regulated weight limit). Leaking fiberboard box. 10x1gal Natures Pure 27% Hydrogen peroxide. 0.1 gal loss from failed safety seal below cap of one bottle. Please note that 1.800.633.8253 (found on product) was called and a request was sent to sds@ambipar.com for the SDS. Report will be updated when more information becomes available.

item.title: Report X-2024070245
item.description:
Report X-2024070245

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained four plastic jugs separated with a fiberboard divider. One of the plastic jugs cracked on the body causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024070268
item.description:
Report X-2024070268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained three glass bottles that were packaged in individual plastic sealed bags. One of the bottles broke and spilled it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and anew declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: During sort operation a plastic jerrycan was dropped during the unloading process at the MEMH location. The jerrycan hit the edge of the catwalk and received a puncture on the bottom. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024070064
item.description:
Report X-2024070064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-29
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 28th during the PM sort a package contained 2 glass bottles of UN1267, PETROLEUM CRUDE OIL, 3, III was found with signs of leakage. One of the glass bottles inside was found broken and the entire contents leaked out. The bottles were in a plastic bag filled with vermiculite, however the bag was unable to contain all of the spill. The package as placed into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted for disposition.

The package contained 6 bottle sand one of them had broken causing the contents to spill. The package was placed into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted for disposition.
